meanings.definition: Thin or slender in form or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The model had a tenue figure on the runway.
meanings.sent2: She wore a tenue dress that accentuated her slim frame.
meanings.sent3: The tenue thread was so delicate that it tore easily.
meanings.sent4: His tenue silhouette disappeared into the distance.
meanings.sent5: The tenue branches swayed gently in the breeze.

meanings.sent1: The painting captured the tenue of the morning light.
meanings.sent2: Her music had a tenue that touched the hearts of many.
meanings.sent3: The tenue of her perfume was so faint, it was almost imperceptible.
meanings.sent4: The tenue of his emotions was like a whisper in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The tenue of the fabric gave it an ethereal quality.

meanings.definition: A state of being weak or insubstantial.
meanings.sent1: His argument had a tenue that couldn't stand up to scrutiny.
meanings.sent2: The tenue of their relationship was evident in their distant interactions.
meanings.sent3: The tenue of the excuse was so flimsy, it was laughable.
meanings.sent4: The tenue of the bridge made crossing it a nerve-wracking experience.
meanings.sent5: The tenue of his resolve crumbled under pressure.
